review_blob: Keg at the Hop Stuff Brewerys Taproom Beer Festival, Mar 2016. Gold pour with a white head. Vanilla and grapefruit aroma which angles nicely into the flavour with a whisper of bitter citrus in there too. Nice .
Cask stillage at the Taproom Beer Festival, 2016, Woolwich. Gold pour with a white head. Bitter citrus and vanilla aroma. Crisp citrus flavour. Refreshing little number. Nice.
Cask at the Taproom Beer Festival, 2016, Woolwich. Black pour with a beige head. Chocolate, licorice and vanilla aroma. Vanilla, chocolate and coffee flavour. Very smooth. Good stuff.
Cask at the Taproom Beer Festival, 2016, Woolwich. Dark gold pour with a white head. Lemon zest, herb and light malt aroma. Vanilla and light malt flavour. Not bad.
Bottle from Oddbins Beer Shop, Blackheath. Hazy amber/gold pour with a white head. Aromas of peach skins, apricot, sweet citrus, herb. Bittersweet fruit tang in the flavour. Sharp, bitter finish.
beer_name: The Kernel India Pale Ale Mosaic Summit Citra

review_blob: Growler from Oddbins Beer Ship, Blackheath. Pours a light hazy gold with a white head. Lots of spice in the nose, spash of sweet citrus. Spice and fruit dominance in the flavour. Tasty stuff.
Bottle at the Barrel and Horn, Bromley. Gold pour with a white head. Citrus and vanilla aroma. Crisp citrus flavour. Refreshing brew.

Bottle from Oddbins Beer Shop, Blackheath. Light hazy amber pour with a beige head. Aromas of summer fruits, sweet citrus, pear and light spice. Flavours of wheat, corn, citrus. Sweet fruit on the palate. Booze laden finish. Nicely balanced brew. Tasty stuff.
Bottle from Oddbins Beer Shop, Blackheath. Hazy dark amber pour with a white head. Vanilla, Peach and tangerine aroma. Flavours of tangerine, pineapple, spice. Bags of warm alcohol in there. Tasty.

Growler from Oddbins Beer Shop, Blackheath. Amber/gold pour with a white head. Banana, sweet citrus and pear aroma. Flavours of pear drops, bitter lemon, wheat. Sharp bitter fruit in the mouthfeel. Good stuff.
beer_name: Anspach & Hobday The Experimental Double IPSaison

review_blob: Can from Oddbins Beer Shop, Blackheath. Hazy amber/gold pour with a white head. Has a nose of herb, sweat and a splash of tropical fruit. Flavours of orange pith, lemon sherbet, apricot and fresh herb. Bitter fruit linger. Nice.

Growler from Oddbins Beer Shop, Blackheath. Amber/gold pour with a white head. Lots of apricot, peach and tropical fruit in the nose. Bittersweet fruit action in the flavour. Light bitter finish. Good stuff.
Dark amber pour with a white head. Orange peel, caramel and sherbet lemon aroma. Sweet citrus and apricot flavour. Subtle bitter nuances. Good.
beer_name: Marks & Spencer Single Variety Hop Jester IPA

review_blob: Golden brown pour with a white head. Lemon sherbet in the nose, spot of bitter fruit in there. Fresh bread and lemon zest in the flavour. Not too bad.

Bottle from Oddbins Beer Shop, Blackheath. Amber pour (light haze) with a white head. Tangerine, apricot and vanilla aroma. Bitter fruit action in the flavour. Bitter fruit finish. Well rounded brew. Very nice.

Can from Oddbins Beer Shop, Blackheath. Black pour with a light tan head. Lots of coffee in the nose, some caramel, toffee and vanilla in there too. Rich, smoky coffee flavours with some notes of demerara sugar and dark chocolate. Keeps its head well. Very tasty indeed.
Bottle from the 2016 National Winter Ales Festival. Reddish-brown pour with a beige head. Has a nose of currants, cherries, prunes and red apple which eases nicely into the flavour. Tasty stuff.
Bottle from the 2016 National Winter Ales Festival. Hazy orange pour. Marmalade and sweet spice aroma. Warm spice in the flavour, soft sweet fruit action. Good sweet/sour fruit balance. Tasty.

Bottle from the 2016 National Winter Ales Festival. Hazy amber pour with a white head. Spice fuelled nose with lots of sweet citrus. Dried fruit in the flavour, splash of citrus, more spice coming through. Nice brew.

Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester. Absolute gusher, the Vesuvius reference has already been made so for freshness this gushed like Krakatoa. In fact it gushed so much I had to console it and suggest it called the Samaritans. Once it calmed down I surprisingly managed to only lose a quarter of the beer. Anyway, black pour with a tan head. Dark chocolate, raisin and licorice aroma. Flavours of burnt spice, licorice and coffee. Despite its explosive character the good carbonation is still there after the storms over. Has a nice sweet finish. Good stuff.

Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester. Black pour with a tan head. Ginger, dark chocolate, raisin and coffee aroma. Raisin, licorice toffee, coffee and chocolate flavour. Lots of dark fruit in the finish. Nice.
Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester. Gold/amber pour with a white head. Aromas of apricot, spice, lots of sweet fruit. More fruit and spice in the flavour. Cant discern any coffee in there. Not bad.
Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester. Cloudy honey coloured pour. Rich aromas of tangerine, marmalade, orange pith, pineapple. Huge fruit burst in the flavour. Lots of sweet juicy fruit. Very tasty.

Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester. Mahogany coloured pour no head. Aromas of toffee, chestnuts, caramel and orchard fruit. Flavours of toffee, treacle, caramel and red apple. Rich, warming taste. Good stuff.
beer_name: Hoppin Frog Barrel Aged Outta Kilter

review_blob: Cask at the 2016 National Winter Ales Festival, The Roundhouse, Derby. Black pour with a beige head. Coffee and chocolate raisin aroma. Flavours of chocolate, more raisin and a splash of dark fruit. Good.
Cask at the 2016 National Winter Ales Festival, The Roundhouse, Derby. Gold pour with a white head. Pineapple and sweet citrus aroma. Lots of juicy fruit in the flavour. Good stuff.

Cask at the 2016 National Winter Ales Festival, The Roundhouse, Derby. Dark brown pour with a beige head. Aromas of gravy browning, chocolate, cocoa and coffee. Flavours of vanilla, coffee and chocolate. Nice.
Cask at the 2016 National Winter Ales Festival, The Roundhouse, Derby. Mahogany coloured pour with an off-white head. Toffee apple and orchard fruit aroma. Orchard fruit and caramel flavour. Nice.
Cask at the 2016 National Winter Ales Festival, The Roundhouse, Derby. Dark brown pour with a beige head. Toffee and chocolate aroma. Licorice, treacle toffee and chocolate flavour. Good.

Cask at the 2016 National Winter Ales Festival, The Roundhouse, Derby. Gold pour with a white head. Tangerine and vanilla aroma. Fruit burst on the palate. A lingering bitterness in there. Crisp fruity mouthfeel. Exceedingly refreshing.
Cask at the 2016 National Winter Ales Festival, The Roundhouse, Derby. Black pour with a beige head. Coffee, chocolate and smoke aroma. More of the same in the flavour. Classic stout taste.

I was first alerted to this beer via the recently departed legend that was Terry Wogan and his good pal Mason McQueen as they meandered round the city of York stopping to sup this at a fine hostelry in said city, so when it cropped up at the National Winter Ales Festival (2016) naturally I had to give it a go. Black pour with a beige head. Dark coffee roast and dark chocolate aroma with a hint of vanilla and raisin. Deep flavours of dark chocolate, cocoa, cola and raisin. Long malty finish. Very good.

Cask at the 2016 National Winter Ales Festival, The Roundhouse, Derby. Gold pour with a white head. Caramel and citrus aroma. Bags of citrus fruit in the flavour. Quite liked this one, would make a cracking session ale.
Cask at the 2016 National Winter Ales Festival, The Roundhouse, Derby. Reddish-brown pour with a beige head. Caramel, toffee and light smoke aroma. Flavours of Toffee, malt and caramel. Interesting.

Cask at the 2016 National Winter Ales Festival, The Roundhouse, Derby. Brown pour with a beige head. Treacle toffee and raisin aroma. Flavours of dates, raisin and plum pudding. Very dry. Tasty stuff.
beer_name: Tiny Rebel / Kyoto Brewing Co. Dubbel Dragon

review_blob: Cask at the 2016 National Winter Ales Festival, The Roundhouse, Derby. Brown pour with a beige head. Bags of sweet spice and toffee in the nose. More of the same in the flavour. Not bad at all.

Cask at the National Winter Ales Festival, The Roundhouse, Derby, 2016. Gold pour with a white head. Apricot, peach and tangerine aroma. Flavours of tangerine, more apricot and peach. Booze laden mouthfeel. Nice.
Cask at the 2016 National Winter Ales Festival. The Roundhouse, Derby. Copper coloured pour with a beige head. Toffee and orchard fruit aroma which continues unabated into the taste.

Cask at the 2016 NWAF, The Roundhouse, Derby. Gold pour with a white head. Apricot, sweet citrus and peach aroma. Crisp citrus flavours with a whisper of vanilla and apricot. Sharp citrus bite. Good stuff.
Cask at the 2016 NWAF, The Roundhouse, Derby. Dark reddish-brown pour with a beige head. Vanilla and chocolate aroma and taste. Not much else.
Cask at the 2016 NWAF, The Roundhouse, Derby. Dark reddish-brown pour with a beige head. Toffee and chocolate aroma. Chocolate, dark malt and toffee flavour. Not too bad.

Cask at the 2016 NWAF, The Roundhouse, Derby. Dark brown pour with a beige head. Aromas of cocoa, coffee, dark chocolate and a hint of blackcurrant. Flavours of woodsmoke, chocolate and dark roast coffee. Tasty.

Cask at the 2016 NWAF, The Roundhouse, Derby. Black pour with a tan head. Chocolate raisin, black treacle aroma with a splash of coffee and vanilla. Flavours of licorice, quite a heavy coffee presence, burnt sugar. Boozy mouthfeel. Warm alcohol down the gullet. Nice .
Cask at the 2016 NWAF, The Roundhouse, Derby. Dark brown pour with a beige head. Chocolate and licorice toffee aroma. Licorice and chocolate flavour. Not bad.

Cask at NWAF 2016, The Roundhouse, Derby. Dark brown pour with a beige head. Heavy nose of chocolate orange, splash of vanilla in there. Orange chocolate flavour. Sweet finish. If Terrys chocolates made beer...
Cask at NWAF 2016, The Roundhouse, Derby. Mahogany pour with a beige head. Orchard fruit and toffee aroma. Plum jam, blackberry and toffee flavour. Tasty.

Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester. Black pour with a dark beige head. Vanilla, dark fruit, chocolate, sweet spice aroma
 Smooth flavours of warm spice, cocoa, pepper, coffee. Warm alcohol linger. Good stuff.
Bottle fro Beermoth, Manchester. Dark brown pour with a beige head. Raisin, licorice and chocolate aroma. Flavours of smoke, dark berries, chocolate and toffee. Dry finish.
Bottle. Black pour with a beige head. Aromas of licorice, burnt sugar, toffee. Flavours of raisin, coffee, smoke,. Very smooth.
Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester. Brown pour with a whispy white head. Toffee apple, caramel, Orchard fruit. More of the same in the flavour. Warm alcohol down the gullet. Good brew.
beer_name: Dark Horse Scotty Karate Scotch Ale
